intro: Hibiscus columnaris, commonly known as the columnar hibiscus, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of red, pink, and yellow, typically blooming during the summer months. Hibiscus columnaris thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and landscapes due to its attractive foliage and vibrant flowers.
